text.p: Here are highlights of stories reported by Hungaryps press, based on information by Nepszabadsagps Hungaryps Around the Clock service. For further details on how to subscribe to Hungary Around the Clock, please contact Monica Kovacs at (361) 351 7142 or fax your request to (361) 351 7141..
ALL PAPERS.
- Prime Minister Gyula Horn wound up two days of talks in Oslo on Wednesday./ @.

- Foreign ministers of Hungary and Poland in a joint statement welcomed US Secretary of State Madeleine Albrightps announcement that an accession agreement should be signed with future NATO members this coming December..

- Visiting Romanian Interior Minister Gavril Dejeu and his Hungarian counterpart Gabor Kuncze signed an agreement in Budapest to improve co-operation against organised crime, terrorism and drug trafficking./ @.

- The National Federation of Hungarian Farmers decided to stage a warning demonstration by blocking roads in two counties next Monday to enforce their demands for the restoration of the tax and social insurance laws in effect in 1996. If they are not restored by March 5, the federation will organise nationwide action for March 10..
- President Emil Constantinescu of Romania yesterday received a visiting delegation of Free Democrats led by party president Ivan Peto./ @.

- Marta Tocsik yesterday appeared before the parliamentary sub-committee probing the allocation of party headquarters to the Young Democrats and the Democratic Forum in the early 1990s, but was unable to prove her claim that she was instrumental in selling a Fidesz party building..
- Hungary is still leading in East Europe regarding foreign investments, according to a recent survey, attracting $13.9 billion, about 30 percent of the total sum./ @.

- Inflation could be lowered to 10 percent by the end of next year, provided that an extensive system of agreements between several interest groups is built out, National Bank President Gyorgy Suranyi said..
- Polgari Bank will go to the state-owned Penzintezeti Kozpont..
MAGYAR HIRLAP.
- The cabinet today is expected to discuss various versions of privatising the truck manufacturer Raba Rt., and decide on changing the administration of the social insurance authority./ @.
- Privatisation Minister Judit Csiha has completed three days of talks in London where she met British foreign affairs and trade officials and investors..
- The production of Opel engines in Szentgotthard was discontinued yesterday due to a lack of parts caused by a Spanish truck driversp strike..
- The hotel chain Eravis reported a pre-tax profit of HUF 11 million..
- The next three years may see the establishment of 20 industrial parks around the country, Lajos Rakusz, president of the industrial parks association said./ @.
- The European Track and Field Championships will be held in Budapest next year and may bring HUF 3.5 billion in releated revenues..
MAGYAR NEMZET.

- NATO Secretary-General Javier Solana, Gen. Klaus Naumann, chairman of NATOps military commission and NATO ambassadors met a Hungarian parliamentary delegation headed by Speaker Zoltan Gal in Brussels on Wednesday..
NAPI GAZDASAG/ @.
- The 1996 pre-tax profit of the Magyar Kulkereskedelmi Bank was HUF 9.2 billion, exceeding its equity by HUF 115 million..
- The nationps two dominant insurance companies, AB Aegon and Hungaria, increased revenues but lost market share in 1996..
-- Budapest newsroom (36 1) 327 4040
